homes_hear_details: Illinois has launched HOMES and HEAR programs administered through the Illinois Environmental Protection Agency and partner organizations. The state received approximately $240 million in IRA funding for energy efficiency and electrification rebates.

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For a family of four in the Chicago metro area, 80% AMI is approximately $72,800. Downstate areas have lower thresholds. Low-income households qualify for up to 100% of project costs under HOMES.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For a family of four in the Chicago metro area, 150% AMI is approximately $136,500. Moderate-income households qualify for rebates covering up to 50% of project costs under HOMES.

net_metering: Illinois offers full retail-rate net metering for systems up to 2 MW under the Illinois Power Agency's distributed generation program. Monthly excess credits roll over, and annual true-up is at the avoided cost rate. The Climate and Equitable Jobs Act (CEJA) expanded support for community solar and distributed generation.

state_tax_credits.name: Illinois Solar Renewable Energy Credits (SRECs)
state_tax_credits.amount: Varies by market; Illinois Shines (Adjustable Block Program) provides upfront incentive payments worth approximately $3,000-$10,000 for a typical residential system
state_tax_credits.eligible_items: Solar PV systems installed on residential properties, community solar subscriptions
state_tax_credits.details: The Illinois Shines program (Adjustable Block Program) provides upfront payments for SRECs over 15-year contracts. Prices vary by utility territory, system size, and whether the property is in an environmental justice community.

state_rebate_programs.name: Illinois Home Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.amount: Up to $8,000+ per home for eligible households
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Air sealing, insulation, furnace repair/replacement, water heater replacement, window repair
state_rebate_programs.details: Available to households at or below 200% of the federal poverty level. Priority given to elderly, disabled, and families with children.

state_rebate_programs.name: Illinois Solar for All
state_rebate_programs.amount: Significant cost reductions making solar nearly free for qualifying households
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Rooftop solar PV, community solar subscriptions for low-income households, non-profits, and environmental justice communities
state_rebate_programs.details: Part of the Future Energy Jobs Act and expanded by CEJA. Approved vendors install solar at no cost to qualifying residents, who receive ongoing savings on electric bills.

programs.name: ComEd Energy Efficiency Program
programs.eligible_items: Smart thermostats, HVAC upgrades, insulation, air sealing, LED lighting, appliances

programs.name: ComEd Hourly Pricing Program
programs.amount: Savings vary based on real-time pricing and usage shifting
programs.eligible_items: All residential customers in ComEd territory

programs.name: Ameren Illinois Energy Efficiency Programs
programs.eligible_items: HVAC systems, insulation, air sealing, smart thermostats, appliances, heat pumps

programs.name: Ameren Illinois Income Qualified Program
programs.amount: Free energy efficiency upgrades for qualifying households
programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, LED lighting, appliance replacement, HVAC upgrades

programs.name: Nicor Gas Energy Efficiency Program
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency furnaces, boilers, water heaters, insulation, smart thermostats
